Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my children, now that I have completed this book, which is the last of medical science, through its completion you may find its end within it, and by its explanations and declarations, it is evident to me that I have composed this treatise for you, which is part of my surgical operations.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since the surgical operation of the hand is practiced in our region and in our time almost entirely privately, despite the importance of its science and the difficulty of acquiring it; and there have been only occasional brief descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have corrected many errors and hesitations but have closed off understanding of it and lengthened its study and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is clear to me that I should enliven that order in this treatise according to the way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and for the forms of the cautery tools and other instruments of the work to be added through the declaration and preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	More so, the reason why a good craftsman does not use his hand well in this our time is that the art of medicine is long and drawn out, and one must be trained beforehand to understand anatomy, which Galen knew well, recognizing the youthfulness of the members and their forms, as well as their joints and separations; and he had knowledge of the bones, nerves, and sinews, their number and their diseases; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the places of their effusion.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this, Hippocrates is said to be silent in the short work, but more so in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	More so, we have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for those who do not know what we said about anatomy, will surely fall into error because of it, and many people have died as a result, as I have seen too many such cases. For some are formed in this science but throw themselves into that other science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen a foolish and inexperienced doctor who, by mistake, caused an apostematosis scrophulosa in the neck of a woman, and damaged some arteries so that great blood loss occurred; the woman died among her many sufferings.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And there is another doctor who nearly removed a stone from a man who had suffered in his condition, and the stone was large, and it came to him, and he dried that stone with a piece of the bladder.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called for it to be extracted, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And there was another doctor who took a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and arrived at a blacksmith named Negro who had suffered a fracture in his thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and stakes of strong structure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then let it slip according to his desires, and then reattach, and then leave it alone for a few days as commanded that we release the bandage; and thus remain until the thigh and foot recover, and proceed to heal.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to untie the ligament, and tranquility and an attempt to relieve his pains was achieved.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But still, since corruption was confirmed in the member, I could not contain that, and did not cease to walk the corruption through the member while the illness persisted.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who incised a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated for several days, during which the malignancy of the lesion increased in the lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the pain is purely due to melancholic humors, and does not affect the entire body, but rather affects a member that suffers from being attacked by all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my son, it is necessary for you that the operation be devised in two ways: one where the operation is associated with health, and another where the work is perilous in its major considerations.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed in this entire treatise where the operation is associated with error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to keep this and leave that, so that the leaves do not find a way to speak ill of you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your arms with diligence and protection of God, and your patients with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God seeking salvation and the praiseworthy success, and lay aside the terrible illnesses difficult to cure, and place your arms in that which fears you, so that sitting in your faith and in your name you do not fail: for more remains to your glory, and less elsewhere in the world and beyond in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia already dissected in some monastic sources:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat evil illness, lest bad doctors be named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already devoted this libel according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered of the foot, in the forms of the instruments and in the tools of the cautery, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and perforation, and on cups, and on plaigs, and on extraction of arrows and similar, all categorized and ordered by the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of tortoises and similar; a chapter ordered by the head between the feet, and by the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On the cautery with fire and sharp medicinal points, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that, the treatment of the entireliber begins.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	First, I will describe the quality of the coals for the cautery and their effects, and in which condition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the cautery coal and its effects is long and tedious, subtle through science, and a hidden secret; many wise men have spoken much about it, and they are in disagreement. For me, a little from their sermons suffices, as I fear the length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that a cautery is applied to the entire complexity universally which is of flesh or sinew, except for two complexities, which are complexities of sinew.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complexity of sinew and dry flesh, they will desiccate; for some said that a cautery is beneficial for this, while others said the opposite, that a cautery is not suitable in illness which is due to quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that an illness of sinew and dry flesh be healed by what is cautery and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And say that those who say the opposite, that by cautery healing is done in all sinew and dry illness that comes in men's bodies, for when you compare the body of man to the elements of his body to the complexity of fire, you find the body is dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to his speech, for I have experienced this myself several times to confirm it.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I do not consider that it comes to me who is already experienced in the practice of cautery through recent exercise, and who has known the diversity of human complexity and the disposition of illnesses in their manifestations, and the causes of those, and the accidents related to them, and the duration of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, it is not about your fear, and especially in wet and cold diseases, for all doctors are agreed on those, and they do not differ in applying cautery to them in youth.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Know, sons, that concerning the secret of curing by cautery with fire and its goodness, on the burning cautery medicine, it is because the fire is simple, its action reaching only the member being cauterized and not affecting other members only to a small harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of the burning medicine reaches that part in the members where it touches, and strongly causes illness in the member that is difficult to heal and rapidly exacerbates it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not cause anything other than to superfluously burn. We have known this through experience and long service studying the art on the true causes; and for this reason, I am excused for the length of my discourse. If it were not that this is not written at my leisure in this pause, and if I did not reveal to you your secret about fire, its quality in operations and the way it expels diseases, I would use a philosophical demonstration, which would be acute in your ears.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And be wise, sons, that they do not disagree about the time when it is convenient to make a cautery and pause the best season of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that a cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage from the accidental season is submerged in the youth of what is burned by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong sores, which do not suffer delay because it is feared that those caused by malice are greater than small damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not done on your parts, or, sons, those who do not esteem it but the common people and the foolish doctors, since for that illness which is cured by cautery it is not always ready, and they pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus because they care for this, for a cautery is not other than in place of medicine which alters the composition and dries the humors which are the cause that wind brings pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, however, excessive cautery over medicine for the expediency of its efficacy and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the patient's illness returns at some point in time, according to the complexity of the illness and the location of the illness, and its virtue, and what is prepared in the body from the aggregation of superfluities within it, and what is acquired in the body through food and semblance of those causes; but the illness where a cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and humidities, just as a dental cautery for pain and similar to that, it is possible that that pain does not return in it, but this is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And more common speech is that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a term used by those who do not understand it, for I believe it is not a cure that helps either from medicine or any other cause except the cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to this; and the understanding that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when one administers the methods of cure in some illnesses, and those medicines are not effective, and at the end of the illness, one administers the cautery, which helps then.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And at this point from here, the last remedy of medicine is a cautery, not according to the understanding which I understand the vulgar and most of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that a cautery of gold is better than one made of iron, and they did not say this only because of the equality of gold and its sublime nature.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cautery does not burn, since it is not absolutely charred; for I have already examined this and have observed that it does not do so in all bodies as in others, and a gold cautery is good and better than iron as they say; yet when you make a cautery with fire of gold, it has not been declared to you, for it ignites according to the quantity you want due to the reactivity of gold, and prepares to receive flame; if you adjust over the ignition, the gold melts by the fire, and it settles in the fire on some sheets so that the craftsman can cut through its occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, you should make the cautery of iron lighter and more precisely to the right position during the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter concerning the cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the leg within the foot, so that I delay the requester what he wants from me.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for head pain due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery addresses the cold and humidity over the servel accident of which there are two causes, these being the cause of soda and much trauma from a traumatic flow, called corissa, in the head, to the branches of the neck and to the ears leaking, and much sleepiness, and toothache, and the jaw, and universally all illness that comes from cold, such as paralytically, soda and apoplexy, and semblanz in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: Primarily, you command the patient to be evacuated with a purgative medicine for three or four nights, according to the virtue needed by the patient, the age of the patient, and the patient's habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command those who shave his head to do so with scissors, and place that sezer between your hands on a lowered bench and have their hands rest on their own foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the edge of your palm razor near his foot between his toes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More over, since the true location is found, mark that location with a pinch, and then heat the olive cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that cautery over the marked location with a pinch, in such a way that it descends gradually, and your hand is gradually constrained, while you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and look at the location. If you see any part of the bone being revealed, as much as the amount of error, then lift your hand. If not, return your hand to that iron or another, if it is cooled, so that what I have said about it can be seen from the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little of salt and dissolve it over the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand over the inguinal wound and leave it there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with an ointment of tetrafarmakon until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And we have said that when the wound is opened wide, it heals better, for it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the condyle should be cauterized inside the bone, and that the cautery should remain until it has fused with a part of the bone.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape what is attached to the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the marrow, pressing strongly on the bone until the bone cools, and this is the method of Alphécatii petit.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate from that place exhale the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and then cure it once it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery for all cases, only in some men out of fear; and leave that one, I advise you, it is better to be salted when it is, because the head is heated by solution of continuity of the sun as we have testified in other members, especially when the head of the patient is of cold nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better, I advise you; use that one and perform that operation with salt.
Capitol segon.	Capitulate second.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the cautery for the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When throughout the head there occurs chronic and long-lasting pain that has been prolonged in the patient, and they use cloths, beans, head poultices, plaisters, ointments, hens' combs, cotton, and linens, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery which does not improve from any of these causes, then consider whether the head of the patient is of strong constitution in its nature; and there is no great cold or heat, then that cautery should be replaced by another.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the top of his head between where the vein is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the vein and expose the quantity which we have counted, and cauterize that with a cautery at the back of the head in the place where it is called vas, — and this is the place where suction is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand here, and do not expose the bone, for the gout by this finds great pain different from the pain of all other cautery marks on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will say this cautery in its place, for I know that the cautery on which one cauterizes the horns of the head and the occiput is a finer cautery than that on which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Capitulum terminatum.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cautery treatment for new migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a sharp pain in the back of the head, or a stabbing pain inside the ear, the head should be treated with medicines that purify the brain, and the other treatment, which I have described for diseases, should be administered; and if this does not help, then cauterization can be performed in two ways: either with a sharp burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May a cautery that burns in medicine be that you take a hot coal, hold it there, and abrade the extremities of it from both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then apply the place of the pain in the temple with a lancet laid between it, make the cut there, and let the needle be concealed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then strengthen over the place stopped by descent compression, and leave it for the space of three hours; then remove the bandage, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then place over the cut submerge in a border until the place dries up.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with ointment while it is healing.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do what some burning medicines allow, which I have written in the second treatise of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cautery be done according to this manner: heat by cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called clavicle, for its head has the form of a small blade and in the middle location there is a slight prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place your hand over the location of the pain, and hold it back—so that the artery which is left is not burned—and slowly rotate the small iron tool.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity that is burned due to the depth of the wound is significant, lift your hand so that the artery which is left is not burned, to prevent bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak it in salt water and place it over the area, leaving it for three days. Then place it like a warm bandage, and keep it treated with ointment until it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you do, cauterize at the end of the surgical blade according to the cautery, and be careful to avoid cutting the artery in this new migrainous condition.
Capitol quart.	Capitulum quartum.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery for ancient headache.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure a headache as we have said in the previous cure, and as we have said in the divisions of diseases, and if the cure is not effective for the disease that does not suffice the above-said first cautery with medicine or the fire cautery, then you must heat the surgical cautery until it is white-hot. Place the line where you feel the pain along its length, or approximately there; then hold your hand firmly for a moment and incise the artery and pierce through to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, you must be careful of the continuity of the jaw, which is weakened by mastication, and ensure that the ligament is not adhered and the nerves which supply it are intact, and that no spasm occurs.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the care and precaution of the flow of blood from the artery that is severed, for in its severing there is fear, especially for one who ignores what he does and is not studious or careful; and leaves the operation at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will bring to memory the regulation of the flow of blood in relation to the artery according to its manner, in this place of this livre.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this illness in someone who cannot bear this cautery and you see the condition of the patient tolerable, apply the cautery in the middle of the foot as we have recounted, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see, apply the cautery which we have said in the chapter on the strengthening of the artery with two knives, and this is a better and more effective cautery.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cautery for headaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is treated with conservative causes and another treatment as mentioned in the division, and the pain does not subside, then apply the cautery, which is called the puncta. This is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then puncture near the beginning, and be led to the outer ear as if a wheel is rotated, or in the circuit of each place if the pain is in any part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Lengthen the cautery from the root of the ear gradually until you have found the location and tested it.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery touches all points in the ear, and you stop there, then thoroughly cure the areas between until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cautery for the ear.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The ear condition, which is cured and treated with a cautery, is only due to substances carried by phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid using a cautery for the substance that causes dryness or spasms of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that type of ear condition with jerris, capipurgi, and guaragismes, and your treatment does not show results, then you must use three cauteries: the first on the root of the ear, the second a small mark on its temple, and the third on the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, for relief only occurs in the part that is healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cautery is to apply the cautery to the outer part of the ear near the tip, placing a small piece over the corner of the head, and on the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the hand's breadth, and then place your hand over the cautery until the quantity of the substance of the conifer has been burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the method of the cautery, and it is specific to the barber-surgeon, whose form is described below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But more subtly, you should see just a little bit less than what you can perceive; and cut away just a little to avoid excess.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what is described until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Capitol. vii.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cautery treatment for ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you have treated it as we said and there is no fever in the patient, then cauterize that with four cauteries: over all the horns of its head; and with a cautery and the middle part of the head, as we said; and with a cautery on the scrotum.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of cauterization is performed as described above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more towards the rear; and then proceed with what you have treated.
Capitol .viii.	Capitol. viii.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cauterization for oblivion by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Cover what is given to the patient at the beginning with large stones and pills of the servant purgative.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then cover the head of the patient entirely and place a poultice on the scrotum as described in the treatise on poultices.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And pause that for some beats, for that is the way of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to that method and order which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore if by those means it is cured; and otherwise, then make three cautery marks on the rear part of his head, which should be descending from the upper part of the head between the lower parts of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause the thickness of a finger between each cautery, and then apply the cautery as it is proceeded.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	More so, if you add more and the patient can tolerate it, then make the cautery in the middle location; and if you have a greater addition, then cauterize that over the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then apply the cautery while it is healing; and let the cautery be olive-shaped according to the form given.
Capitol .ix.	Capitol.ix.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cautery for paralysis and the healing of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Cover that you process in modification of the head with jerras and as we have said; then raise the head of the patient, and carefully place a cautery on the middle part of the head, and a cautery on all the horns of the head, and a cautery on the back part of it, and three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the disease of softening of the body for them and the gout sufferers, and the disease is strong, then apply a cautery to them with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and behind with a cautery where it is completed by the skin of it, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then cure that when it is healed, and this be an olive cautery.
Capitol .x.	Capitulum .x.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of the cautery for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	No is it cauterized the epileptic, but only if the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And thus modify the wound at the beginning of its edges with a hot and cold application, which we have described in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the child does not tolerate the medicines, then administer gargling and mouthwash remedies, preparing them for several days beforehand with good nourishment.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And near the head of the patient, and apply a cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous method, and another cautery at the occiput, and over each horn of the head, he cauterizes.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates it, then apply the cauteries I have mentioned, having first paralyzed and softened the body around the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use an olive oil cautery as described before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use a fine cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Capitol xi.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cautery for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are damp and gross flame, then apply the cautery to those areas where we have said in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess moisture turning into melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then let him drink that which purifies his brain according to what was said in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And place your hand on the head of the patient, and properly make a tortora (a type of cautery) over the circle, and then pause that one in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient rest quiet, and be kept from all disturbance.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And place the liniment; it is most fitting for an old sheep to bear this.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over the fire for tempered warmth by measure, which it bears when more is in it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place something in the middle of his head in a circle, and let it be fumigated.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this for the patient every week once, using the other regimen until it is healed; or if you wish, make a small cautery mark according to its size, but keep your hand on an ordered cautery: this is a kind of cautery which you moisten equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cauterized area on a border or piece of gauze.
Capitol .xii.	Capitol. xii.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the cautery with descending water.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When the beginning of the water descending in the foot has been declared by the signs which I have said in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient what modifies his pulse, and keep that free from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And boil that sugar in water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to raise his head, and cauterize that with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize that with two cauteries on the temples if it is the beginning of scalding water in both hands, or of one burn if it is the beginning of water in one hand.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize all the veins and arteries which are left without a bond; and let the cautery be in that place along the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard against flows of blood when it is cauterized; and if you see the flow of blood, stop it with any medicine which is within your reach.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will bring wisdom which is in the extraction of arteries and in their cauterization, as well as caution about flows of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck leaving two bones to be produced by two cauteries.
Capitol .xiii.	Capitol. XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the ancient cautery of tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the feet are ancient and through the veins and arteries, which are in the manifest place of the head above, it is verified that this is excess phlegmatic humors, then cautery that area with a cautery as we have recounted in the chapter of the beginning of water cautery in the feet, and make a cautery in the middle of the head and two cauteries on the neck placing two temples, and make two cauteries on the neck placing two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is indigestion, then cautery the area on the sole of the foot at the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cautery for nasal odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your treatment with what we have said in the division does not improve, then prepare and give to drink to the patient chicory for three nights; and shave his head, and cautery the area with a medium-sized cautery and an olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a pointed cautery on both supraorbital regions, leaving the hair a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And guard that the artery not be burned there.

De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	For the cautery for softening the eyelids of the feet.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery for the eyelid when the skin is converted to the inner parts and palm of the hand.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eyelid is converted to the inner parts, I must puncture the eyelid. The cautery for this can be performed in two ways: either by a hot cautery or by applying a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If using a hot cautery, command the patient to look away from where the skin is to be burned as one would when cleansing the skin, ensuring it is thoroughly and evenly applied; and if puncturing, place the point at the origin of the eyelid. Then strengthen the eyelids with a bandage so that they do not tear before the skin has healed.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, once the skin is healed and even, place the head of the patient on a pillow, and then apply heat to the eyelids, marking the area with a mark shaped like a laurel leaf, which will be the starting point of the incision for the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place something hot in the abdomen or on the bladder over the belly.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then heat the cautery, of which this is the form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which is marked, little by little in small squares, while the surface of the wound, which is like a laurel leaf, is completely burned.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of health from your work is that you see the eyelid of the belly already contracted and the skin around it raised from the puncture of the belly.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it for three days, and then place it again carefully on the spot between where the scar is healing.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply ointment until it heals.

Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with medicine burning it is what you command the patient to stretch the skin while it is elongated and ensured to be even, and then make a leaf-shaped form of paper from cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known soap and fresh fat, or what is instead thereof, and mix these fats well, and prepare this mixture to ensure it is not rubbed; then spread this over the paper which is made thus in the shape of a leaf of mint, and place that over one or both wounds; and place the remaining portion wrapped in cloth, and the patient's head be at the top.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc. E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus, when the patient perceives that the bite of the medicine, then leave the medicine and place it at the top as just said; therefore, when the bite ceases, then put back the medicine and wash the wound with water; and then consider if the eyelid has already been raised, if so, you should constrict it with fire or incision, for then this is good; and if not, return to the application of the medicine at the place where it did not press and ensure that your operation remains even and contracts the wound.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place your hand over the side where the adhesion's bond is to be removed, and cure that with an ointment or something else in which it may be healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must, in your operation, keep careful vigilance that no mistake of medicine fall into it. If the eyelid becomes softened and some cause of the skin pustules on the eyelid, then repeatedly apply your medicine to that place which has become softened, and do so precisely as you did at the beginning, and soon let it heal.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the way to prepare the willow leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyelids of humans are diverse in size and smallness, and therefore according to this you should make your incision.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way to straighten it should not be hidden from those who study in this art.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the lacrimal gland of the eyelid.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula as we have said in the divisions of diseases and do not bring your cure to completion, then when you cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place his head on your lap, and have some minister between your laps in such a way that his head is neither hurt nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place the hot iron on the skin of the calf or over the lump of the ankle on his heel.

le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is hollow, such as the shape of a cane or a bird's feather quill, from one end of which the cautery is made.

E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, let it be drawn out like a needle.

And another method of cautery for a fistula which some first doctors will say: place it at the location of the fistula and do that and then place your hand on that fissure like a thin form of it. Pour in there the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; hold your hand in good retention, so that the bad humor does not enter through that which the melted lead does not penetrate to that place; cover over the location of the fistula until it is covered as if in white of an egg or in water, for lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals that through marvelous healing.

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the mouth.

Then cure that with what we have said about the cure until it is healed.

De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc. Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The cow's horn cautery is done by taking a bull's horn and placing it over the tooth area. Then take this and wrap it around the end of the probe, and immerse that part in the heated bull's horn, and hold it over the painful tooth pressing quickly before it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeatedly do this several times until the heat from the fire permeates to the root of the teeth.

Moreover, however, the cautery from fire you must attend to the wound of skin or of iron, and in its core there is some grossness and the acuity of the fire not penetrate to the mouth of the malaise.

And then shape the cautery as it will come, and place that one on the tooth and put your hand in between until the cautery is well rubbed; and do this a few times so that the pain may not be aggravated on that day or the other day.

E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to this count and because the cauterizations are .viii.

De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of cautery of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When pain in the stomach is caused by cold and humid humors that extract from its composition and multiply there, if you continue the methods of cure and do not relieve it, then you will know that gout is on his back spreading its hands and its things, and then cauterize that area with three cauteries: in one cauterization, place the foot with the quantity of a finger's breadth using a small cautery, and with two cautereizations place them on both sides of the cauterization, forming the figure of a triangular cautery; and leave a space between those not adjusted to prevent suppuration.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery the quantity of two-thirds of the thickness of the chain.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be as follows. E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be cauterized by puncturing where someone is afraid from this cautery: and you touch the stomach with a pointed instrument according to the quantity you wish to try, then cauterize that place with the cautery; then cure it with the cure that follows until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of the cauterization of the sore foot.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the foot due to coldness or humidity or excessive windiness before it has returned to its normal composition through superfluous egress, and the patient is treated as we have said and not comfortably, then you should ensure that the foot is raised above the level of the hips. Touch three cautery points according to this form and this quantity placed on the foot below the iliac bones, with the heel elevated like a person lying on their back.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be according to the thickness of the finger, and let the cautery be according to the length of the body straightened.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not hold the cautery too long.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the quantity of what is applied equals the weight of the specific part of the leg, and it is not adjusted more; and if the wound is standing on the feet of the patient; and if not standing, then lying down, which has already extended its parts, lifting its thighs.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a surgical cautery when you have subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And guard that you do not overapply the cautery, ensuring that only the specific part of the leg is cauterized so that the heat does not spread to the intestines, as the leg here is delicate; and know this.

De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of an abscess in the foot with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When an inflammation or abscess is in the hip and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the hip or in its covering, then if it is in the flesh of the hip, the patient will feel a greater gravity and sharpness of pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	If it is in the covering of the hip, then the pain will be very sharp and often causes doctors much fatigue treating it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina. E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize it such that the entire chain of joints is heated, until it reaches the hip, in order to achieve a healthy scab.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with the treatment for other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And ensure that you use only the cautery about which study has been made in the art of medicine, and on whose marks most doctors are familiar; but this one, after some experiments, has been found suitable for this operation, so I leave that to your discretion, and it is better.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cauterying the pleura.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	They said that the ancient cautery for pleurisy should be applied according to this manner: take from the branches of aristologia a long piece of wood that is found there, and let it have the thickness of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge that in oil and place it on the fire, and then cautery with a cautery in that location which is between the continuation of the furcula and the collar; and leave two small cauteries guiding them, one slightly inclined towards the part where the beard starts, and two more cauteries in what is inclined between the fifth rib and the thirteenth, inclining slightly towards the rear parts; and another cauterization in the middle of the foot; and another on the stomach, and three cauterizations at the rear parts; and one cauterization in that location which is between the two shoulders, and two cauterizations on the sides of the foot, leaving the cauterization between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not hold your hand on the cautery, but keep it at the edge of the wound working.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some ancients have said that certain men use a cautery resembling a red hot iron, and they place it in the location between the ribs, until we bring it from there to there eliminating the pus, as we have said when treating the arm.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	More in this puncture, there is no fear, for he will soon suffer if the location of the fistula does not heal.

De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	Of the cautery for the boil.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you cure the illness of the boil, follow what we have said about the cure in division and do not vary your cure. The cautery for the boil is performed in three ways, all of which are correct. One way is to make three or four lines according to the length of the boil, following the figure of the cautery for the arm, the figure of which has been shown before.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment. E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not place your hand on the cautery; let the patient be held over its back.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And this is another manner of cauterizing, so that you kindle the cautery having two vertements, which we have said in the chapter of dislocation of the muscle, and lift the cord which is in the direction of the limb to let the juice of the patient's left side flow out.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your elevation be such that you lift the cord according to the length of the body, so that the cautery is made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then place the two vertements together, ignite them, and in that space where you insert the cord from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then withdraw the cautery; and thus he makes four cauteries.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you burn, use a cautery having three veins.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then cure the cautery after it has been let to burn for too many days, as this is more conducive than other previous causes in the treatment.
