De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the cautery for dropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauterize not in dropsy but in the affected area properly.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat the dropsy, use the methods of treatment that we have said in the division, and do not deviate from your treatment. Instead, apply four cauteries in the circuit of the heart, one on the stomach, another on the liver, another on the spleen, two between the vertebrae of the back, one on the right side of the foot, and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the depth of the cautery be approximately equal to the thickness of the skin.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then leave the cautery open so that it gets cool for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And you do not evacuate the bad humor from the wound while the cautery is hot so that two intentions are added to it, and it will be speedily healed with the help of health.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery with which the belly is cauterized should be spatule-shaped according to the form described above, and this is the one with which the two eyebrows are cauterized according to the form described previously.

When the feet are swollen and filled with yellow water, heat the foot by cauterizing it over the bone where the shinbone is between the ankle and the thumb, raise your hand with the cautery and do not twist that area; then raise your hand, and do not return to that place entirely, as the yellow water drains.

The cautery is to be used according to the length of the thigh: and place one end high on the thigh and the other low at the lower part of the thigh; and on each thigh, two cauteries.

De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the cautery of the abdominal region.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris. De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Of the cautery of fistulas that arise in the natural passages of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not obey the work we have recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened by this, it should be treated with a cautery.

And guard yourself from burning nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or the body of the intestine, then guard yourself from all those areas; and do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshly location and you perceive that it is not penetrating.

E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the area is sealed, and the materials are detached from it, and remain this way for a long time, then you know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the materials do not stay on the wound, then you know that they are penetrating or in the process of corrupting the flesh, or this comes from those causes which will be recalled in its place.

De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of cauterization of the groin.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is inflammation and moisture in the groin, and as a result, coitus is prohibited, and the menstruation is disrupted, and induction of labor is delayed, and joint pain occurs due to this condition, then it should be cauterized with three cauteries around the umbilical region, as we have said in the cauterization of the bladder; and apply one cautery at the lower part of the foot, or use two cauteries, and ensure the cautery is well prepared.
Capitol .xl.	Capitol of the chapter.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of the cautery for dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist humors infiltrate the region of the ankle, and these are causes of displacement in its place, a sign of this is that the swelling extends over the other foot when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the site of the dislocation is treated on the side of the foot.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then cauterize the foot around the region of the ankle with a circular cautery, as you will have marked with a tent in the circuit of the region as it is rotated, so that the region falls at the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the form of the cautery mentioned above is used in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not present, then use three cauteries of large olive size.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And the cautery should be made according to the intensity of the pain in the entire limb; and then cure that which remains until it is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XL.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of the cautery of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the sciatic nerve and its cause is cold and humidity, the patient is treated with the method we have said, and you do not apply anything else, which is an ancient practice. When you are aware that the illness is due to thick humors, treat it with foul-smelling pills or artificial ones similar to them; then cauterize the area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of cauterization in this case is according to two methods: either with burning medicines, or with a fire cauterizer.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	Sir according to two known methods, of which one is to cauterize the area above the width of the foot with three triangular cauterizations in this manner; and do so with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the spacing between each cauterization should be the width of one digit, and the cauterizations should be either olive-sized or larger.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Sometimes, after a few passes, cauterize in the middle of the location on the head of the anqua, as these are four cauterizations.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize around the circle where the form precedes in the cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle, let it be a circle that burns the sensitivity of the entire tendon.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the way to cauterize locally when pain is localized to the ankle and not extended to the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it is extended to the thigh, then cauterize there with two cauteries on the thigh over the area through which you will pass the ankle that causes the pain; and with one cautery on the heel, you should slightly raise the lateral part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if it is a surgical cautery, the depth of the cautery should be according to the sensitivity of the tendon.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the ankle passes the pain to the area near the toes of the foot, then cauterize there where you will pass the cautery with three or four points or more if needed.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the ankle passes the pain to be near the knee, then cauterize there with a surgical cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	Guard in all cautery that you do not end with the cautery to such extent that you burn nerves or great artery, and that by this you are over the patient badly hurt or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen several cases where cautery was applied to the navel and ended in the cautering, and the bed charcoal inflated between which the tumor reached the skin, and fire perforated and corrupted all the skin.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And often follows a strong ventricle contraction, and often death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts, cautery each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise will say about the cautery of water: this is the manner. Make it like a circle of iron, with its circumference the width of one palm; and make its holes according to the size of an finger bone or at most a little more.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And inside that circle, there is another third; and the space between them is the quantity of a finger's breadth; and those circles are opened in two parts; and the length of those gaps is one finger's breadth or two; and make on the margin of the iron appropriately fitting to the circles; and this is the form of it.
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	It is heated in the fire until it turns red and sparks, then placed over the part of the water, the patient lying on the mat.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And then cauterize it with three round cauteries in one go.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be for three days; then apply a plaster with honey and let the wound remain open for many days; and cure it by anointing it until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: Oh, my son, we have used this type of cautery rarely because of the fear of looking at it, and due to those few things we found concerning it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But for those who have suffered good cautery, find the place for it.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	But for medicines that adhere, make two circles having an arm with a perforated hole through which the smoke from the iron door passes; let the length of the wall where they are be as wide as two or three fists.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space which is between each of the quantity of the swelling of the digit; and be opened down and up, and should contain themselves among them according to this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then place your hand over the part of the ankle where the patient feels pain, and hold your hand over the part of the water; and take some hot water and pour it between two circles, and let the quality of that be like fire little by little, and have that for the quantity of one hour, and suffer the patient the biting and tightening — for that atrocity bites like fire — until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then lift your hand with the instrument and remove the hot water from all the water with cold water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then let that be for three days and place your hand over that border until the blackness of the tightened wound fades, and let this be for some days, and the redness will go away; this is known in youth.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it by applying ointment until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is extended to the thigh or hip, apply a plaster containing water as is done in the water.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the way of applying water cauda, and I have already written that in the treatise on the preparation of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkali and for the extinguished caustic from both halves, one part is three times larger, and you pause in a new bowl where the half left has a small hole drilled through it, according to the quantity that enters it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And pause placing the bottom of the bowl in another warm bowl, and pour over the alkali and live caustic with warm water until it covers by an inch, and then hold those with your hand for good compression, and let the bowl that contains the warm water drain into the half left in the warm bowl.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then adjust all that water, and pour it over another live caustic and new alkali, for then it will be of great strength, which is administered in most operations of medicine and in the cautery of other members, for such operation makes use of fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And some of the medicines, which are to be cauterized wide, such as tiglium and mel anisatum and cause them to be assayed that they be mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Gualia recounts the operation and cure of an ancient man suffering from water pain and sciatica, magnifying the good deed, and says that no other treatment was necessary, for he was cured in one day as recommended, for he immersed himself in warm and cold baths as instructed.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it should be placed near a vervain herb, and if vervain is not available, a fresh fig should be used; it should be tied with a few threads and placed on the water where the pain is, or on the thigh, or on the chest, and it should be pressed.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for the quantity of three hours or for the amount of time the patient bears the compression.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then place it in warm water; when the patient's body is relaxed, insert it into the ground, for the pain ceases and the patient is cured.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that none of these medicines are used with a cautery except near the body's evacuation.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	When making a cut in the sinew vein, cauterize it, and it will heal better; and the cautery should be applied in this manner: take wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the layers of the foot and over the bone.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take a dry cut of wool and inflame it in fire to make it char; then place it over the wool and let it smoke.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And repeat this, and continue doing this until the heat of the bite reaches the water and relieves the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cautery is called the calf cautery.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cautery for joint pain.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes pain in the two [places] is caused by multiple reasons, such as from a wound or striking or excessive evacuation, and due to similar causes, through the infiltration of wet matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And the cautery should not be used except in this single instance where it is applied due to the infiltration of wet matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, open, and place pillulas fitidas and similar to them, which are applied over the two areas where the pain is present three lines according to the width of the area. Then mark with cautery or more in each line, according to the quantity that comes from the tolerance of the patient and the virtue of the cautery.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And the cautery should be applied with a pointed cautery.
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, apply the cautery with three or four medio-clavilh cauteries according to this form.
Capitol .xliii.	Capitol. xliii.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On the cautery at the beginning of gilbositat.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	When signs of this illness appear in small children; and the sign of the beginning of it in children is that they experience difficulty in eating, rising, elevation, and movement.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And you find in the lower vertebra of the back and of the neck that it begins to protrude above the other vertebrae.

que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	that the cautery covers all parts of the vertebra equally.

E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And let the points be close to each other.

Capitol .xliv.	Capitol XLIV.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cautery treatment for gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And thus, gout caused by infiltration is cured through a method of treatment rather than just alleviating the pain, but rather with cautery.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And you cauterize there near the site of evacuation in the circuit of the foot joint with pointed cautery.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the olive-shaped cautery, the form of which is as follows:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar. And if you need to use cautery irons for these cauteries, then cauterize them and do not press your hand too close to the cautery before, just around the size of a cone.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pains penetrate to the elbow and knee, then apply the cautery which we have said in our chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pains are only in the muscles and it is called "myalgia," then puncture along the course of the nerves as they run, puncturing in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pains remain in the fingers, then puncture along the course of the nerves over each joint and over the back of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pains remain for several days in the shoulders or the muscles, then cauterize the areas around all parts of the shoulders.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And if you do not evacuate the patient properly and do not administer medicines well, then even if good regimen and flame are used, this cauterization will not be effective, God help us.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of cautery for ruptures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a rupture in the groin and intestines are visible through the skin, and this begins to develop nearby, then when you order the patient to fast on that day and use mild remedies so that the wound in their abdomen may close.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And return the patient between your thighs over their abdomen, and command them to hold their belly with force until it is stitched or the skin or intestine appears.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And return that one between your thighs, and touch the rupture over the bone of the thigh, marking the extremity of which is similar to the size of a circle in the upper parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then heat the cautery of which this is the form:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it be hot enough and sparks begin to fly.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent it from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	Then place the cautery over that mark with your hand holding the cautery straight, and keep it there until you succeed in burning through the tendon halfway down the thigh; and repeat this on another occasion if you have not succeeded in the first attempt.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	Observe wisely the pulse of the patient during your cautery, that you do not burn the intestine so much that it leads to death or another great harm.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	Be careful that when you use the cautery, you do not burn the bone, as this would compromise your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And ensure that the cautery for children is fine according to their size and measurement.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And then care for the area of the cautery for three days, keeping it between the points where the scar from the fire heals.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that as with other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient lies on their back for 10 days until the area and wound are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And ensure that you support the patient's nutrition according to the length of time for the healing of the wound which closes his abdomen, and that the intestine does not come out with great effort to heal.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then when it is time to lift after 10 days, properly apply a poultice, and keep it for another 10 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let it rest from work and the replenishment of food and drink, and use strong voices, for when it uses this regimen of healing entirely, it will be cured.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will say the healing of ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and at the beginning, if you do not want them to tear again, then cauterize the rupture with a round cautery according to its size; and what is excreted from the wound should be treated as the tender part of it. Then care for that as we have said, and it is not dressed.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some first ones have said that rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, rather than with forceps.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And a line is placed there for the width in the cuts and passes above the rupture, and another line on top; then place your hand with a cruciform cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Capitol XLVI.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of the cauterization of tortio.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain in some members persists due to congestion or percussion and does not respond to medical treatment over a long time, then you should cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery should be of the size and shape appropriate to the member, its nature and intensity, and the location of the tortio and pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Then if it is healed by the first cautery, that is good; but if not, then repeatedly apply the cautery to it; for customarily such pains are punctured from member to the neighboring member, so that you may achieve what you seek with the cautery before the malady is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of the cautery treatment for leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Lepers are sometimes cauterized with a very hot cautery, especially when the species of leprosy is caused by the putrefaction of flame and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so, if you want to cauterize the affected area, consider whether the leprosy is common and similar to that which we have discussed in the division. If it is not, and you fear that the corruption might encompass his entire body and all its complexity, then cauterize the affected area on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and two at the sides; leave one behind, on the neck or shoulder.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finish your hand with a cautery slightly pressing into the cheek to create a small impression, so that the expiration of thick vapors is relieved; and cauterize on the cheek as necessary.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If leprosy is already spread over the thigh and clearly manifest, then you cauterize that area as well as those cauterizations which we said in the head; on the tip of the nose, and two cauterizations on both armpits, and two on two vertebrae of the neck, and six on the vertebrae of the back, and one large one near the buttocks, and one on the spine, and two on the thighs, and one on each thigh, and two on the shins, and one on each shin, and two on the knees, and one on each knee, and two on the ankles, and one on each ankle, and two on the feet, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of their foot; cauterize that on all joints of the fingers of the arm and of the foot, and on each heel of his feet.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And guard the nerves which are over the heels that you do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes cauterization is done with one cauterization on the bone of the pelvis and another on the opening of the stomach, and another on the navel.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more tightly you apply the cautery, the more beneficial and lasting it is; and know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery, as they do with their seams, for thus the patient's body is already numbed.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cauteries should be large or small according to the limbs and joints as indicated by the sizes of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And place the cautery on flour mixed with honey and other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Capitol. xlviii.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the cautery for stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When some limb is numb or paralyzed and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and does not heal, then cauterize that numb limb with cautery according to the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery penetrate the depth of the wound a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that which is ointed until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And in some cases, it is cauterized a certain stupor which affects the thighs and the feet, and the vertebrae of the back, and the inflammation of the nerves which run through that member, and the stupor is relieved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not assume this except for one who is wise in the anatomy of the members and the exit of the nerves throughout the moving body.

De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of blisters that are morphew.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When blisters are old and do not respond to any of the medical ointments, then cauterize over that with a cautery, using a little according to the quantity of the powder. Allow the whiteness and color of it to be relieved, and its color to change.

And then cure that which is ointed with flour of err (a type of grain) and lentils in rubbed oil and leaves of arnica, or with dove's blood or with duck's blood, taking a part of each, all mixed together. Then place a cloth over the area until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of cautery for the groin.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins and you want to stop it, then cautery it with a circular cautery in the circuit of it as it is rotated.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas. De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of cautery for adenitis.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some adenitis is delayed in maturation, this is either due to excess causing it, or due to the condition of the patient, who may be old and decrepit, with little strength, or due to time, and if you want to hasten the maturation of adenitis; then cautery it in the circuit of it with multiple small puncturing cauteries; and leave that which will mature on its own.

De cauterizacio de corrodent.	Of the cautery for corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a wandering corruption in the member, which corrodes that part as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you find the corrosion in a location where you will apply a fire cautery, then ignite the cautery with a few hot coals, and large ones as is appropriate for that location where the corrosion occurs.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that completely as you remove all the corrosion and do not leave any cause of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And for three days let that be, and place a hot cautery over the cauterized areas until all the blisters are eradicated and all the corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And for that cure the flesh generating wounds with ointment.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days the flesh grows healthy in the area where there is no corruption, that is good; but if not, then reapply the cautery to the areas that are rotten in the corrupted places.

Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nevertheless, a cautery with fire is more beneficial for quick healing.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the treatment with sharp medicine in the division, so use that when you need it.

De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the Cauterization of Wounds and Other Similar Conditions.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Moles viewed near the sole of the foot in which the disease called claw is present, and it is a large, penetrating cause that affects the foot; in these cases, cautery is performed according to two methods, one with fire and another with water-cauterization.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	The cautery with fire is to heat the concave cauterizing tool resembling a half circle, which is made of iron according to the quantity it contains for the entire sole, and has fine edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then place that ignited tool on the sole, and quickly move your hand over the cauterizing tool in a circle around the sole until the heat reaches the depth of the sole.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	Let it remain on the sole for three days until it begins to blister.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then apply a poultice with chopped wild mallows salted, and let the poultice remain on that area for one night until the swelling is reduced.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with a cream of generative flesh until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	If so non-convertible, and motas veguadas accideysso in the superficia del cors, majorment in las mas e les pes, then when tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, et prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, and pause aquela sobre le clau; then geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, and rete tu ma, and tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, and inpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, and atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; and espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, and aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And do the same for the other entering which you come over all of them in their parts of the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then cure those pus that the roots of the claws have been eradicated by applying ointments which the flesh will regenerate.

De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of the cautery for trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When there is a tremor due to friction in the nerves or from fever of some cause, or for another similar reason, then you should cautery it with four or five cauteries on the spine, placing one cautery between each vertebra, and one on the feet, and one over the stomach.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor subsides, and the illness is healed.

De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of the cautery for accidents in the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body abscesses are formed and pus-filled cavities are created from corrupt materials; then at the beginning as they appear, they should be cauteryed with a fine cautery dipped in myrtle wood charcoal, the end of which is extended over the fire; or with an herb stick of ephedra; or with a flat round cautery.

Capitol lvi.	Capitol lvi.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of the cautery treatment for flux from an injury due to arterial incision.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times, flux from an artery that is incised appears, causing a hole in the wound, or due to the incision of an abscess or cautery on the member, and then it seems difficult to stop that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Then, when such a case occurs, hold your hand over the opening of the artery and place it firmly there. Hold it in that position until the flow of blood has stopped, then remove it without letting it come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	Then, over the fire, hold the olive cauteries both small and large, in several places, and blow on them until they are ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take one small or large piece according to the place and wound where the artery is broken, over that vein press strongly as you have drawn back what you said, and hold the cautery so that it cuts and restricts the bleeding.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the hole of the artery when you draw back what you said and tighten the cautery, then take another cautery freshly prepared from the ones that are in the fire, and therefore do not cease to do this one after another until the bleeding is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And beware that you do not burn the nerves here, and that no other evil comes to the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to restrict the bleeding in those cases, especially when the artery is large, unless one of four methods is used: either with a cautery as we said, or with extraction when it is not extracted, or when it is extracted, its extremities are burned and the bleeding is restricted, or with lixiviation with honey or with astringent herbs, or by pressing with bandages of suitable constriction; and they should be tightened with a pulvinar for proper compression.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	More than that, he who administers proper restriction to the patient with flax and bandage or by position of causes burning and similar, does not confer any benefit but harm.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	More if such a thing happens to someone and neither the doctor is present nor medicine, then open gently with your finger the indicated orifices of that vein as we have said, and understand the great contraction within which the wound has remained from the upper part of the lesion, and above the archery let the finger not be moved; and above the archery let it be sprinkled with cold water fomented with great coldness before the wound is closed and thickened; and more cossire in that where cauterization or medical necessity.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and ventozas and of bloodletting and of lesions and their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all illness in which cauterization with fire is convenient and medicine burning, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary among those of the forms of cauterizations; and I have ordered the chapters of the subiranetat of the cap between the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And you shall proceed in this chapter in such a manner, so that the one who seeks this may be relieved of it, whenever he has requested it.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin this, hear, sons, that in this chapter we treat of what is in the first chapter concerning cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And hear that you be in great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter, many cases of evacuation occur which if mishandled can lead to serious consequences. You must ensure the proper aspersion of the vein or incision over the abscess or excision of the wound or purgation of the plague or extraction of the arrow or incision of the boil and similar procedures.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And in all of these, there is fear and trembling, and in the greater part of them, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that this applies to you in the position where it is situated, for sometimes cases arise where your methods may be at fault due to the patient's condition.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And from them some you will go to his illness and if it is slight you should let him die, and this because of the intensity of what he finds of his illness, and for the length of his illness, and in the illness there is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those who give to you their advice, you expecting from that health, and his illness is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And so you must consent to him who comes to you of whom this manner is; and your caution be greater than covetousness and your greediness; and do not presume any cause upon that but rather certain science which verifies what you should do, and to which by succession praiseworthy success shall come.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your patients by predicting and indicating to them to which health is converted, for in that you shall have help in the acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O, children, God inspires his understanding in you and does not deprive you of direction and protection, for this is in His hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have also arranged this chapter distinguishing it into chapters according to what was previously discussed in the chapter on cautery, for the treatment from head to foot, so that you may be alleviated with what you ask about and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the treatment of water that is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness often appears in children at the time of birth and when the mother strengthens the child's head during nursing.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes appears for hidden causes that are not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I do not see this illness in adults; and for all those children in whom I see it, death is certain, and thus I have been left with no choice but to treat them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child's head was filled with water, and his head remained constantly swollen until it could no longer bear its own weight due to the size of his head, and furthermore, the moisture increased until death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity or is added between the tendon and the bone, or is added by placing the bone on the cushion.

This is the form of the spatum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore, if the humidity is much increased and the abscess is larger, then here make two fissures in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is on the bone, the sign is that you will find the edges of the tendon open from all sides, and the water oozes out when you compress it with your hand at the internal parts; this is not what you want to hide.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Cut in the middle of the location on the side and make three fissures in this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	and carefully extract all the humidity; and strongly bind the fissures with bandages and pillows; and on the fifth day, pour oil over it, and remove the bandage and dress the wound with lint and ointment, strengthening the tendon with equal parts; and let the patient eat dry food of little humidity until the member is comfortable and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which consider when the magnitude of the abscess and the collection of the water appear; for sometimes it is more in the occiput, or in the front part, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore attend to the incision where the abscess and the filling with water appear, and do so according to what seems best to you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not incise the artery and attempt to flow blood from the patient through that flux of blood for the evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called hazises.
Capitol segon.	Chapter II.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When we encounter a clot or wound in the heel or on the foot, it is customary to not consider the treatment of medicines at that time, but rather the incision of these two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore cover when you want to incise those that the disease reaches its head, and nearby rub the area with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and nearby strengthen the neck of the patient with some cloth; and nearby consider where the vein pulses; and the areas of each over the areas near the ears pressing, as they are hidden in some people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then place your hand on the artery and feel it, and next incise each part sharply with a blade that penetrates into the bone, and do this for the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, insert the blade letting the artery and cut it where the incisions are made above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision should be two digits wide, for when any vein is cut, the bleeding occurs with a pulsating outflow, which jumps frequently through the flow.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the pulse, then measure the distance of three digits from the ear, and next feel it, and make an incision into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And what must be let of the bleeding is one pint of blood, and more or less according to its strength, all of which depends on the quantity that appears from the virtue of the patient and the fullness of the artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and therefore if there remains any cause of suppuration on the bone, next incise it so that no abscess forms.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with down feathers and pieces of cloth, and apply care to it with ointment until it heals.
Capitol .iii.	Capitol III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When an ancient or acute migraine occurs due to atmospheric humidity and the quality of air in the temples, or is very severe and resembles those, and is treated according to the methods of medical cure, if it does not respond to these treatments, then we have resorted to the extraction of arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of the operation and extraction is that the patient lies down on their back; and understand the apparent artery in the temple where it is shown to you by your pulse, and is visible in only a few people due to its intensity.

E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And when you take the spatum of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you scrape the tendon where you pass through the artery; then place wax there and extract that from the upper parts where you extract it from the tendon and uncover those of the tunics, leaving that, from all parts.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is fine, then wrap it at the extremity of the vein, and then divide a part thereof according to the quantity for which the extremities of the vein are lengthened and contracted, and thus there will not be a flux of blood; for if not divided, it will not rise up.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood from the vein once in three days.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then cut that in two locations with a double strength ligature or with long cords, and do not allow putrefaction before the consolidation of the wound and thus there will be a flux of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then incise the excess which is between two threads; and do so at that time or shortly thereafter.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that with a cautery between the bone and cauterize with a surgical knife when the extremities are incised, and it will be in place of that metal work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better to do so if the patient has fever or is of a febrile constitution; for a cautery is among those causes that help to resolve humors, and therefore it is better in treatment.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And cover the area of the artery extraction with a cloth properly placed, and place it over finely powdered substances. And after that, with dry medicines, let flesh grow and with warm applications until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while working another round you encounter flow of blood from the artery, then you should constrict that blood, either with a cautery, or by placing a cloth there, and strengthen your hand until the blood is constricted.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if for any reason it is not at your present, then place your hand on the area between where the wound should be cleaned, and moisten the area with water of great coldness so that the inflammation subsides, and be strengthened according to what is suitable.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is lighter in the extraction of an artery is that you cautery the vein with this cautery having two knives, after you have touched the two areas with your fingers, and place some hot coals between them until they reach the bone and cut the vein into two parts, so that what is between the extremities of it is elongated, which are not consolidated by this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two knives is essential.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if the sharpness of the two knives is not sufficient, it is better to use three, for if they are as sharp as two knives, they can easily reach any part and do not cut the flesh too quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Then when there is some swelling, hold the heat from the fire in those areas and the flesh is cut slightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in every work and more gentle.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And place the space which is between two knives the amount of the swelling of the digit.
Capitol quart.	Capitular quarter.

que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	that is from the division through the temple into the second incision.

And place the edge of the sharp side against the adjacent flesh, and the edge inside the bone, and push it into the migrating fissure, and cut away all vessels that descend from the head to the heels.

Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	For the cure of tears due to catarrh and those descending from the inner parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When there is an acute and continuous cold humor, and the feet of the patient are often weak and small, and their general condition shows debility, and the eyelids are ulcerated and in the prepuce its condition is acute pain and extreme tension, then you should know from these accidents that the humors and catarrh do not come from the venous motas of the inner parts.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure in such cases is this: you command the patient to rub his forehead, and then incise along a fissure in the middle of the forehead, a small one in width (starting from between the left and right temples; and with the incision into the bone, extend your hand through the temple muscles which are tense and should be carefully cut), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry up all the blood with a sponge or a dry cloth, and then insert between the two edges of the incision a small piece of cloth or a bandage.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen from above with powders infused in wine and oil so that it does not develop into an abscess when cauterized.
