And if it is of red color and the root is large, then do not touch that with iron due to the flow of blood; first let it mature, and then either you will incise it, or it will break by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, tender, and the root is fine, then it is to be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And in the operation, you must consider before your operation whether the abscess has already rested and is completely cured or if it has decreased somewhat; then operate on the patient before the sun, with his head on your lap, and lifting his mouth, and a servant holding his tongue between their fingers, taking the noblest instrument of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And let it be made of silver or steel, and let it be sharp like a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	So when you press at that tongue and the abscess is shown to you, and cut over it quickly, then take a probe and place it in the abscess, and pull it outwards as far as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing you pull from the tunics, and then incise that with the instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is similar to forceps, but the ends are curved, so that the opening of each of those is in the straight part of the other, sharp points, which should be made of iron and well tempered.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	If this instrument is not at your disposal, then incise that space from which this form comes: it should be sharp on one side, not on the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have incised one wound, incise the other according to this manner of incision, and near the incision the sore should heal with water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a flow of blood, heal with water from the decoction of crushed colocynth or of hollyhock leaves and similar to those causes that constrict the flow of blood, and cure that once it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes sores appear in the groin or other abscesses elsewhere on the two ears, and incise those according to what is said and done in the incision of two wounds equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I had already treated a woman with an abscess which was located in her groin, which abscess tended to have a brown color, with little sensation, and which had already closed her groin. The woman breathed freely, and had been prohibited from eating and drinking water, and she was close to death if more water were to remain for one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had already been pressing so long that there were two handbreadths between where it would exit through two cuts.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore I would incise the fistula completely and fix it in one of its ends, then pull that end, stretching the large portion. Next, I would incise the other part, and firmly hold the mouth of the other cut, grasping its tongue, and finally fix the end in the abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I would cut a large part of it, but blood was flowing from it only in small amounts.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore the swelling was gone from that woman, and she began to drink water soon, and also eat food. Then I did not cease incising that abscess for a long time, and an abscess would recur in its place, which continued to form as long as the previous one lasted.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore I enlarged and cauterized the swelling, then applied the plaster; next, I walked around and did not know what God had done to that nearby me.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXV.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of the incision of the heel when it is swollen.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When a catarr (catarrah) affects the uvula, and it is swollen and long, then it is named perpendicular; if it is in the part large and round, then it is called a bubble.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	When it is cured according to what we have said in the division, and you do not find your cure agreeable, and thus you often observe that the abscess caut has already passed away and become subtle, then probe that you incise that which is aggregated round; if it is at that length, and it bleeds, of dusky color or black, and is not a centimeter, then you should fear the incision of it, for there is fear concerning the illness.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you observe that according to the manner I have said of its whiteness and length, you should lance the illness and press the tongue of it with an instrument of which you determine its form and then fix the needle in the new site, and draw that down and incise that with one of the two instruments which are called in the incision of two abscesses.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And ensure that you do not insert it further than what is adjusted over the natural term of addition, for if you insert it more, you will alter its speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And near the insertion, use what we have described in the insertion of two fingers, and ensure that it is cured within.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the patient was frightened by the insertion, ensure that you use anesthetic in the cautery to alleviate his fear, and the way of applying the cautery is simply with sharp water. You should place the head of the patient in your lap, and then press the patient's tongue against the instrument as described. Additionally, take the sharp water from the section on cautery application, and apply it to the area without being too thin or subtle. Fill the cavity of the instrument according to its shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the external part of the cavity in which the medicine is applied be as wide as the handle of a ray, and place the instrument with the medicine over the vagina, while the patient opens his legs to allow saliva or mucus from his mouth to enter through the internal medicine, so that it does not decrease for any reason on the ligaments and affect him.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then place your hand on the medicine, and express it over the uvula for half an hour between each time you let it darken due to the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take some cloth and wrap it around the tip of the reed, then immerse the cloth in the medicine, and insert the reed with the cloth into a tube from above so that the cloth adheres to the tube. Do this as many times as needed to achieve the cauterization of the uvula you desire, and then let it dry and fall off in about three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to apply the medicine again, apply it, and then cauterize the area around the uvula with a wrapped cloth. Modify what is in the circuit of the uvula by the medicine, and wash it with water, and treat externally by soaking and internally with remedies until it heals.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this method of treatment is safe and long-lasting without fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some cases of tonsillitis are cured by what is finer than a cautery or incision, which is treated with subfumigation in this manner: take calamus, hyssop, origanum, rue, scikadis arabicus, camomile, powder and resemble those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes, or some of them, in one ointment, and be submerged in vinegar and boil; let the ointment be well beaten with decent honey, and let it be in the middle of the ointment a wick, over which is placed an instrument hollow of iron according to this manner; let it be made of silver or iron.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the extremity be inserted in the mouth of the patient so that the vapor rises to the tonsil above the uvula, so that the uvula becomes somewhat obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then it repeatedly passes over those spots several times while they are dry, and guard that you do not perform this cure at the beginning of the appearance of abscesses, for it would too tightly bind the abscess. You should not do this, but declare the abscess with a cautery.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument at hand, then take a cane and place on its end a clog of wood, so that the opening of the patient's anus is blocked, for the wooden clog prevents the vapor from burning the opening.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and what adheres in the wound and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Spots or thorns that adhere in the wound or from a thorny plant or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then carefully extract what is obvious and visible from the wound or thorn, by pressing the tongue with an instrument in front of the sun, so that you may know what is in the wound.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what is not apparent and hidden in the wound, make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because if the cause attached to the wound is strong, it will be expelled through vomiting; or have the patient swallow a piece of napkin or flax cloth or a piece of dry bread; or take a piece of sponge dried with wine and tie it tightly with thread, and make the patient swallow that, for it will reach the place where the thorns are located and will be expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And take an eel and wrap it in honey, then place it inside and gently extract it; or take a pepper and gently insert it and then remove it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	And if none of these methods work as we have said, then use a lead instrument in this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be as thick as a small finger, and at the end of it, have a cavity that you insert into his throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let his head be raised up, and guard that the touch of his bone in the throat reaches him, so that it affects him and either what covers the bone or the spine, or what that doctor places with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	And instead, let the patient himself insert honey, by his knowledge of the place of the cause and cover it below, and pull his hand towards the instrument, all this according to the quantity which is prepared for him before it becomes ineffective.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	From the extraction of gouty fluid associated with the gout.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the gouty fluid is treated with what we have said in the division of the treatment with medicines and you do not agree, consider at the heat of the gout during the gout attack in the sun, for you may have misunderstood the language of the instrument we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the gouty fluid, extract it either through a small needle or with fine threads properly.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to extract it through that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the gout attack of the gout. Then place a burning iron in the concavity of the cannula, and do this as many times as necessary (until the gouty fluid is dead and stays out of the gout attack), and let the patient abstain from water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a towel full of water, work its mouth into the area, and wash the area with it; and do not swallow any part of it, but let the water remain on the area for about an hour using your hand, as soon as the gouty fluid senses the water it will begin to drain.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	If it is not already fomented with what we have recommended, then foment the thigh with cimeter or asafetida using the instrument we have recommended in the fomentation of uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it may heal.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And another way of fomentation is that you take a bowl in which are burning coals and the bowl is covered with a cloth in the middle of which there is a hole, and place the end of the instrument in that hole; then proceed with the subfomentation; and place the thigh on the end of the cannula, and close its end so that the subfomentation does not get extinguished until you see that the subfomentation has reached the uvula, for the uvula will soon fall.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not heal, then you repeat the subfomentation several times, and abstain the thigh from drinking, eating salty foods and others, and do not drink water. It is necessary that this regimen be followed.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument used to treat gout when it is seen; and it resembles tongs as you see them, but with some curvature in it:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	and the end of it is similar to the beak of a stork, which is wide, and on which it is filed with a file, so that when any cause is grasped, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Capitol.xl.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which the essence of the speech concerning abscesses and their sections is found.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are special kinds of boils, according to various methods as remembered, for each one in this treatise.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are varied in puncturing and sectioning them through two methods. Of these, one is according to the kind of abscesses themselves; and by this, they grasp the humors.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is according to the places where bodily accidents occur, for an abscess in the head is different from an abscess in the buttocks; and an abscess in a fleshly place is different from an abscess in a joint; and each one of them has its own judgment through operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And of abscesses, some which cover that they should not be punctured but rather wait for the maturation of the healing in those or their complement.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And of other abscesses which cover that they should be incised when crossed, and are not maturing according to their complement, thus like abscesses that are near joints, for an abscess when near a joint, the essence of it is prolonged into what is within that circuit, and greatly corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing contraction of that limb; or it is near the main member, and if you delay the incision of it until its natural maturation for the main member; or it is near the anus, therefore incise that which is not matured; and it should not be incised raw, due to incomplete digestion, but one that is near the anus, so that no preon from it can extend into the inner parts of the anus, and a fistula may be formed, or what is done in its term until it is healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	And you should know the time for the incision of the abscess, and this is when it is matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is ripe when there is the reduction of pain and the cessation of fever, and the diminution of inflammation and pulse, and the acuteness of the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And know when to make the穿刺在脓肿下方的位置，并且是脓液从切口排出的时候。
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the puncture should be made along the length of the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in the parts near the groin or feet, and at the location of the groins, the cords of the nerves, the arches; and, otherwise, in all similar locations where there is no reflection; for in those that are reflective, use puncture according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	And when the abscess is in a fleshly location, it is better to wait until the digestion of the pus is confirmed according to its natural course, as we have said; for if you puncture it before this, you will prolong the course of the pus and mucus, and increase the thickness and depth of the abscess.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	More abscesses should be punctured according to the width of the flesh or body as necessity demands, or according to that from which the member suffers.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And see that you administer a small puncture in large abscesses, and a wide or multiple sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And in other abscesses, see that the cord is returned to its cavity and tied, when this is done as with bread and done in such a way that it stays, just as one does for crops of melons and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised with a section having three angles; and of those in which an incision is made as the shape of a holly leaf, just as with abscesses of gout.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of these, see those in which a round section and a crescent section are administered, and similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	More for those in which none is done as such, where the abscesses are superficial, see that you puncture them with a superficial puncture, or flat one only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has already collected some healthy pus, you should pierce it and do not hesitate to extract all the foul matter at that time; having extracted one part, then pack the abscess on another day, and extract a larger part, and repeatedly do this until it is thoroughly drained.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of verdure virtue, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an old person in decline, for the animal spirit has resolved into the exit of the healthy fluid, and greatly alleviates the illness, so you should openly proceed.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Take great care with this chapter, and when you make your puncture in which you perforate these abscesses, ensure that you clean the wounds and consider whether the wound of the abscess is small, or a flat section, then administer either herbs or cumin seeds; if the abscess is large, and the cracks of the puncture are deep, then you should pause to allow them to heal together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the cord has been cut or you have concaved it in the circuit, then you should close it with old wool or with a thread made of linen, just as when you have drawn out bandages or roots, their humidity; strengthen it on the third day; and proceed with it and cure the area as what is appropriate from ointments until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If you happen to have a flow of blood during the time of your operation, then you administer hot water mixed with wine in which you soak a cloth, and place that over the location of the blood flow for many minutes.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the flow of blood persists, then you must administer treatment and care, as well as powders which I have recommended in many places of this our libel and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is in the time of winter, and the location of the abscess is near major nerves, then you should apply powders mixed with wine and oil using a cautery, and place those over the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the locations are fatty, then you should place powders soaked in water and oil or in wine and oil, all of which should be applied within the first three days, as we have said, and then you should incise the abscess, cleanse it, and administer to it what is appropriate for its healing within the time that it heals.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary regarding the knowledge of the treatment of abscesses universally, but according to the division I have already spoken of, all abscesses are treated in a particular manner by chapters singly.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XL.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the section on abscesses that occur in the vein of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the vein of the head, small abscesses occur, and they contain nodules which are formed; and the nature of these nodules is spotted.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they are lumps, and among them are those that contain a humidity resembling lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And among them are those that contain a humidity resembling dust, similar to it; and among them are those that are hardened, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of these, there is no fear, just as you should not fear the extraction of these without causing any resistance.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation for the section of these is that you puncture them with an instrument in the form which is close at hand, which is called a lancet until you know it contains fluid.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	If what is contained is humidity, then section that with an instrument along its length for a superficial section in this manner:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin in the section of line B between line G. Then as the humidity is evacuated, you scratch that skin which contains that humidity, and leave none of that cause of all, because too many times returns if left of that any cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse it in Egyptian ointment if present, and otherwise in water and salt; then apply it to the wound and leave it there for another day, because with it you will dissolve all that is rotten of that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeatedly apply it to that part with Egyptian ointment gently if you need it, confident that there is no rotten cause of that skin; after that, cure the wound with ointment while it is healing.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if there is an abscess containing fatty nodes, then you incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	In the section having the form of a cross, and make an incision between two sides of the section, and sweep all of it away, and exert your virtue in extracting the tunica which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your artery resists, then do what I recounted to you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, make the incision and for treatment as we have said before; the incision over an abscessed lump is lighter, because it has little bleeding and little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes such abscesses in the head have no humidity; the cause of which is that I cannot incise an abscess on a woman's head, so I probe and extract the abscess like a hard, rough, white pear that could not be cut, and if any were subjected to percussion, it would burst.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other abscesses in the head, this is not covered in this chapter; as with abscesses that occur in children's heads, you should drain the ears, but the incision for all of these should be a superficial one.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And place the incision for those below the knee in such a way that it relieves the body of the disease to the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then attend to those things that concern the cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section on scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Black spots often cause abscesses in the neck, in the armpits, and in the groins; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and the spots that are generated among them, and all scrofula of these is within its own membrane. Just as with nodules and abscesses in the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	The species of these scrofulas are spots. Some are rough, and some contain moisture, and the malignant ones do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Then in that one which you find to be of good disposition in the Touchement, where the color that is manifest is similar to the color of the skin, and is diffused throughout all parts, and is not attached to the nerves of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and is not a swelling, cut that one with superficial dry incisions from the upper part to the lower part along the line of G. to the line of B., and scrape it out completely, and extend the edges of the skin flap outward with needles, or with several small needles if you need those, as we have said in the case of abscesses in the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that the vein or nerve not be injured.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	Let the incision not be too deep, so that it does not touch the vein or nerve with your hand during the operation, or to relieve the patient, and do not cut what is not necessary to cut; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and stop yourself from operating, then apply a glass of salt or other powders which are fluxes of safron, strengthen the wound, and leave that in which is paused the acuity of the abscess and makes the wound mollified and begins to suppurate.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is incised.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	So return to your operation once it is completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire if there is any other cause for the small scrofulas, so cut and cure those.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is near the vein of the scrofula, avoid cutting that scrofula near the vein.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Before you place a strong fold of cloth there, let that lie in such a way that it may fall by itself.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old wool which you have already soaked in Egyptian ointment, and then dress it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the scrophula completely, then you must adjust the two lips of the wound and press until there is no further discharge.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is excessive discharge due to the size of the scrophula, then you must understand to incise its base, remove it, and administer suturing as described.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for those scrophulas containing humidity, make a superficial puncture at the place where it appears, and pause the puncture below where the dry pus of the body accumulates, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the puncture, applying ointment and similar substances to it, so that it dissolves what is rotten from the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you see that the wound is already clean, then apply the cream of generative flesh for its healing.
Capitol .xliii.	Capitol XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the section of the ulcer from the abscess in the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients performed this section in the inguinal region, and no one in our land has ever seen it done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men with oblique veins, a cavity should be avoided during the excision of the inguinal region, for if this is not done properly, all the veins and major vessels of the groin may be injured.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses on the mouth or groin or ears, when the illness is not in the brain, it is advisable to use the section of the inguinal region to avoid the damage caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	When we want to do this, incise the epilhotium and leave three or four small circles of the epilhotial rings, each in the space between two rings by quantity, so that the section is in chondral, not cartilaginous tissue, and this place is suitable for a section, which is devoid of flesh and the vessels of blood are low.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor fears this, he should do so when he extends the thread of the needle away from him, and then cut the thread just before it reaches the channel, but more importantly, avoid the vessels of blood if he sees any.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise the cicatrix as we have recounted; and it is significant on the section of the channel by the flame which is from that ignited by what is of its disjunction and by the interruption of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	And when the time is delayed in which the perforation is feared, add two loops of the thread of the wound, and sew that one to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that cause flesh to grow where it is missing.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Abu casis says that the essence of what we have recounted, the exposition, is merely that you see which of those abscesses have already drained pus, and the patient has come out of danger, with his life preserved. Some go on to incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe through a small opening in the area of the wound, thereby saving him from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this, I order to keep the wound open until the malignity of the illness is consumed; and the malignity of the illness lasts for three days; and then, when it is time, I order to close the wound and treat it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen with my own eyes is that a servant took a knife and placed it in the patient's wound and incised part of the root of the lung. I was called to treat this case, and collected the blood as it flowed from the small wound. Then I uncovered the wound and gathered the blood which was flowing from it.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore I must confess that there was no incision of vein or artery, and the wind has passed from the wound, and cured her where it was injured.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And she did not suffer any injury, not even in her voice, and soon returned to her normal state.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the case of the paronychia there is no fear.

Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Capitalize the abscess which has occurred due to nerve injury.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Similarly, an abscess can occur in arteries and veins, and similarly, an abscess can occur in nerves when there is percussion injury or injury due to excessive work, and similar cases.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is most frequent in the areas of the joints or the thigh, or in any location where the joints are inflamed.

quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	A lunar cautery is used in two positions together, either for a flow of blood or during the plague when it has broken out.
